info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 1:32AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. .Rainfall has largely ended across the river basin, but runoff of the earlier heavy rainfall continues to raise river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. At 17.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. Floodwaters continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and the old railroad bed. Floodwaters may start to inundate the shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:16 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:16 AM EST Wednesday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight Wednesday night. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 10/17/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EST.
